properties.name: blogPost
properties.description: A posting that is part of this blog. Supersedes blogPosts.

CreativeWork.name: about
CreativeWork.description: The subject matter of the content.

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityAPI
CreativeWork.description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityControl
CreativeWork.description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityFeature
CreativeWork.description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityHazard
CreativeWork.description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: accountablePerson
CreativeWork.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: aggregateRating
CreativeWork.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

CreativeWork.name: alternativeHeadline
CreativeWork.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: associatedMedia
CreativeWork.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

CreativeWork.name: audience
CreativeWork.description: The intended audience of the item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

CreativeWork.name: audio
CreativeWork.description: An embedded audio object.

CreativeWork.name: author
CreativeWork.description: The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

CreativeWork.name: award
CreativeWork.description: An award won by this person or for this creative work. Supersedes awards.

CreativeWork.name: character
CreativeWork.description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

CreativeWork.name: citation
CreativeWork.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

CreativeWork.name: comment
CreativeWork.description: Comments, typically from users, on this CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: commentCount
CreativeWork.description: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

CreativeWork.name: contentLocation
CreativeWork.description: The location of the content.

CreativeWork.name: contentRating
CreativeWork.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

CreativeWork.name: contributor
CreativeWork.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: copyrightHolder
CreativeWork.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: copyrightYear
CreativeWork.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

CreativeWork.name: creator
CreativeWork.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork or UserComments. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: dateCreated
CreativeWork.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created.

CreativeWork.name: dateModified
CreativeWork.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified.

CreativeWork.name: datePublished
CreativeWork.description: Date of first broadcast/publication.

CreativeWork.name: discussionUrl
CreativeWork.description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: editor
CreativeWork.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: educationalAlignment
CreativeWork.description: An alignment to an established educational framework.

CreativeWork.name: educationalUse
CreativeWork.description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

CreativeWork.name: encoding
CreativeWork.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia. Supersedes encodings.

CreativeWork.name: exampleOfWork
CreativeWork.description: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of. Inverse property: workExample.

CreativeWork.name: genre
CreativeWork.description: Genre of the creative work or group.

CreativeWork.name: hasPart
CreativeWork.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork. Inverse property: isPartOf.

CreativeWork.name: headline
CreativeWork.description: Headline of the article.

CreativeWork.name: inLanguage
CreativeWork.description: The language of the content. please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.

CreativeWork.name: interactionCount
CreativeWork.description: A count of a specific user interactions with this item—for example, 20 UserLikes, 5 UserComments, or 300 UserDownloads. The user interaction type should be one of the sub types of UserInteraction.

CreativeWork.name: interactivityType
CreativeWork.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

CreativeWork.name: isBasedOnUrl
CreativeWork.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

CreativeWork.name: isFamilyFriendly
CreativeWork.description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

CreativeWork.name: isPartOf
CreativeWork.description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of. Inverse property: hasPart.

CreativeWork.name: keywords
CreativeWork.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

CreativeWork.name: learningResourceType
CreativeWork.description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

CreativeWork.name: license
CreativeWork.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

CreativeWork.name: mentions
CreativeWork.description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

CreativeWork.name: offers
CreativeWork.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, or give away tickets to an event.

CreativeWork.name: position
CreativeWork.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

CreativeWork.name: producer
CreativeWork.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

CreativeWork.name: provider
CreativeWork.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller. Supersedes carrier.

CreativeWork.name: publisher
CreativeWork.description: The publisher of the creative work.

CreativeWork.name: publishingPrinciples
CreativeWork.description: Link to page describing the editorial principles of the organization primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: recordedAt
CreativeWork.description: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event. Inverse property: recordedIn.

CreativeWork.name: releasedEvent
CreativeWork.description: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

CreativeWork.name: review
CreativeWork.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

CreativeWork.name: sourceOrganization
CreativeWork.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

CreativeWork.name: text
CreativeWork.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: thumbnailUrl
CreativeWork.description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

CreativeWork.name: timeRequired
CreativeWork.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

CreativeWork.name: translator
CreativeWork.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market.

CreativeWork.name: typicalAgeRange
CreativeWork.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

CreativeWork.name: version
CreativeWork.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

CreativeWork.name: video
CreativeWork.description: An embedded video object.

CreativeWork.name: workExample
CreativeWork.description: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook. Inverse property: exampleOfWork.

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: description
Thing.description: A short description of the item.

Thing.name: image
Thing.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
